data.title: Most popular Scottish baby names
data.meta_description: Take a look through our favourite & unique Scottish baby names and see if there is anything that you fall in love with for your girl or boy.
data.text:
Searching for the perfect baby name can be tricky as there are just so many to choose from. If you are stuck for inspiration, choosing a name based on its origin is a great idea and will help you to narrow down your options.

Turning to Scotland for your naming inspiration is a great idea as there are plenty of unique Scottish baby names to choose between. Scotland is a beautiful country with a fascinating history, so it is no surprise that it is also home to some great baby names.

On this list you will find Gaelic Scottish baby names steeped in tradition alongside names inspired by Scottish islands, and plenty of unique Scottish baby names just waiting to be discovered. All you have to do is decide which one to pick!

Scottish Baby Girl Names

1. Ailia

This Scottish Gaelic baby girl’s name means ‘from the strong place.’

2. Elspeth

Elspeth is the Scottish form of Elizabeth and means ‘chosen by God.’

3. Ainsley

If you are looking for uncommon Scottish baby girl names you will love Ainsley which means ‘meadow.’

8. Sheena

The Scottish name Sheena means ‘God is gracious.’

9. Jean

Jean is the Scottish form of Jane and also means ‘God is gracious.’

10. Bonnie

Just like the name Bonnie suggests it means ’cheerful’ and ‘beautiful.’

11. Iona

The name Iona refers to the island just off the Scottish coast.

12. Isla

The popular name Isla means ‘island.’

13. Fiona

Fiona is a name of Gaelic origin meaning ‘white’ and ‘fair.’

14. Eilidh

Eilidh is a lovely Scottish name with a great meaning of ‘radiant one.’

15. Isobel

Isobel is the Scottish variation of the name Elizabeth which means ‘pledged to God.’

16. Edin

The name Edin means ‘place of pleasure.’

17. Alba

The Scottish Gaelic name for Scotland is Alba making it a perfect Scotland-inspired name choice.

18. Annabel

Annabel means ‘loving’ and is derived from the Amabel.

19. Skye

Take inspiration from the beautiful Scottish island of Skye.

20. Shona

The name Shona means ‘God is gracious.’

21. Ailsa

Ailsa is a Scottish name that means ‘elf victory.’

22. Paisley

Paisley is a Scottish girl’s name inspired by the place name.

23. Davina

This Scottish baby girl’s name means ‘beloved.’

24. Alexandra

The name Alexandra means ‘defender of mankind.’

25. Lorne

The name Lorne means ‘chieftain’ and is also a Scottish place name.

26. Morag

This traditional Scottish girl’s name means ‘great.’

27. Maisie

Maisie is a Scottish short form of the name Margaret which means ‘pearl.’

28. Greer

Greer is one of the most uncommon Scottish baby girl names on this list and means ‘vigilant.’

29. Lorna

The meaning of Lorna is believed to be ‘fox.’

30. Lexi

Lexi is now used as a name in its own right but is derived from Alexandra meaning ‘defender of mankind.

31. Kenzie

Take inspiration from the popular Scottish name Mackenzie with this shortened version which offers a fresh take on this popular name.

32. Mirren

Mirren is a Scottish girl’s name meaning ‘beloved.’

33. Kirsty

This popular Scottish girl’s name means ‘a follower of Christ.’

34. Islay

If you are looking for something a little different from Isla, Islay is a great option and is derived from the southernmost island in the Inner Hebrides.

35. Lyla

Lyla is a pretty Scottish girl’s name meaning ‘island girl.’

36. Lynsey

The name Lynsey is believed to mean ‘lake’ and ‘from the linden tree island.’

37. Kirstin

Kirstin is believed to be a Scottish form of Christine and means ‘follower of Christ.’

38. Ailes

Ailes means ‘noble’ and is the Scottish form of the name Alice.

39. Yvaine

Yvaine means ‘evening star’ and is an unusual Scottish baby name for girls.

40. Leslie

The name Leslie means ‘holly garden.’

41. Catriona

The name Catriona is the Scottish form of the name Catherine and means ‘pure.’

42. Marsali

Marsali is a distinctive and unusual Scottish girl’s name and means ‘warrior.’

43. Fenella

Fenella is a Gaelic name meaning ‘white shoulder.’

44. Morven

The name Morven is a Scottish name that means ‘lives by the sea.’

45. Lilias

Lilias is a Scottish girl’s name that means ‘lily.’

46. Jamesina

Jamesina is a female variation of the name James meaning ‘supplanter.’

47. Innes

The name Innes means ‘piece of land between two rivers’ and ‘island.’

48. Mairi

Mairi is the Scottish form of the name Mary, but a popular name choice in its own right. Mairi means ‘bitter.’

49. Kyla

Kyla is a Gaelic name that means ‘narrow strait.’

50. Garia

The Scottish name Garia means ‘short.’

51. Kina

The name Kina means ‘little one.’

52. Machara

The Scottish name Machara means ‘plain.’

53. Moibeal

This sweet Scottish name means ‘loveable.’

54. Callie

The name Callie means ‘from the forest.’

55. Rhona

The name Rhona is believed to mean ‘rough island’ after Rona an island in the Inner Hebrides.

56. Blaire

The name Blaire means ‘battlefield.’

57.Vaila

Vaila is an unusual Scottish baby girl’s name that means ‘foreign island.’

58. Tandie

This uncommon Scottish baby girl name is sometimes used for boys too and means ‘fire.’

59. Gormlaith

The name Gormlaith means ‘princess.’

60. Caitrin

The Gaelic baby name Caitrin means ‘pure.’

61. Peigi

Peigi is the Scottish form of Peggy and means ‘pearl.’

62. Lilidh

Lilidh is a Gaelic word for ‘lily.’

63. Davonna

Davonna means ‘beloved.’

64. Davita

Just like Davonna, Davita means ‘beloved.’

65. Vevina

This melodic name means ‘sweet lady.’

66. Moire

This sweet Gaelic name means ‘star of the sea.’

67. Eara

The name Eara means ‘from the east.’

68. Mckenna

The pretty name Mckenna or Makenna means ‘child of the handsome one.’

69. Elsie

If you like the Scottish name Elspeth, but want a name that’s a little less formal, Elsie is ideal. Elsie means ‘pledged to God.’

70. Allison

The Scottish girl’s name Allison means ‘battle famous.’

71. Doone

Doone is a Scottish girl’s name that means ‘hill.’

72. Kerr

Kerr is an unusual girl’s name based on the surname and means ‘from the rough ground’ or ‘from the wet ground.’

73. Eibhlin

The name Eibhlin is Gaelic and means ‘desired.’

74. Aurla

Aurla is the Scottish variation of the name Orla and means ‘golden princess.’

75. Ferelith

Ferelith is a strong Scottish girl’s name that means ‘true sovereignty.’

76. Annella

The name Annella means ‘grace.’

77. Donella

Donella is a Scottish girl’s name that means ‘world ruler.’

78. Kenna

Kenna is a Scottish feminine version of the name Kenneth and means ‘fiery’ and ‘handsome.’

79. Sorcha

The name Sorcha is a Gaelic name used in both Ireland and Scotland and means ‘bright’ and ‘radiant.’

80. Senga

The name Senga was historically popular in Scotland, but is now a pretty rare name choice. Senga means ‘slender.’

81. Eileen

Eileen is a Scottish form of the name Helen and means ‘bright’ and ‘shining.’

82. Morna

The name Morna means ‘festive.’

83. Beitris

Beitris is the Scottish form of Beatrice and means ‘voyager.’

84. Eimhir

Eimhir is the Scottish Gaelic version of Emer and means ‘swift.’

85. Arabella

Arabella has been a popular name for Scottish girls in the past and means ‘yielding to prayer.’

86. Kenina

Kenina is a feminine form of Kenneth meaning ‘handsome’ and ‘fiery.’

87. Deòiridh

Deòiridh is a Gaelic name meaning ‘pilgrimage.’

88. Gavenia

This strong Scottish girl’s name means ‘white hawk.’

89. Rae

Rae is the Scottish version of the name Grace.

90. Gordania

This unusual Scottish baby name means ‘great hill’ and ‘hill near the meadow.’

91. Janet

Janet has historically been a popular name for girls in Scotland and means ‘God is gracious.’

92. Muireall

The name Muireall means ‘sea.’

93. Eune

Eune is a sweet, simple name meaning ‘victory.’

94. Oighrig

The Gaelic name Oighrig means ‘speckled.’

95. Ceit

Ceit is the Scottish Gaelic spelling of the name Kate meaning ‘pure.’

96. Leana

Leana is a Scottish girl’s name meaning ‘serves John.’

97. Nessa

Nessa is a Scottish name that means ‘pure.’

98. Sima

This Scottish baby girl name means ‘listener.’

99. Athdara

Athdara is an uncommon Scottish baby girl name meaning ‘from the oak tree ford.’

100. Aggie

Aggie is a shortened version of the names Agatha and Agnes, and has enjoyed popularity as a Scottish name in its own right. Aggie means ‘good.’

Scottish Baby Boy Names

1. Rowan

Rowan is a cute Scottish name that means ‘little red head.’

2. Mackenzie

This Scottish baby boy’s name means ‘little hollow.’

3. Bowie

If you are looking for uncommon Scottish baby names, Bowie is an excellent choice and means ‘fair-haired.’ Bowie is also an excellent choice for David Bowie fans!

4. Lennox

The name Lennox means ‘elm.’

5. Andrew

Be inspired by Saint Andrew and name your little one this popular Scottish name which means ‘brave’ and ‘courageous.’

6. Lachlan

Lachlan means ‘from the land of the lakes.’

7. James

The name James means ‘supplanter.’

8. Blair

Blair means ‘child of the fields.’

9. Cameron

This Scottish name means ‘crooked nose.’

10. Drew

The name Drew means ‘strong’ and ‘manly.’

11. Caden

Caden is a Gaelic name and means ‘battle’ or ‘spirit of battle.’

12. Carson

Carson means ‘son of the mash-dwellers’ and ‘son of Carr.’

13. Brody

This Gaelic name means ‘ditch’ and ‘broad island.’

14. Bruce

The name Bruce means from the ‘willowlands’ and ‘thick brush.’

15. Scott

Scott is derived from the name of someone ‘hailing from Scotland’ or a person that speaks Scottish Gaelic.

16. Glenn

The name Glenn means ‘living in the valley.’

17. Irving

The name Irving means ‘green river’ and ‘sea friend.’

18. Ciaran

The name Ciaran is of Gaelic origin and means ‘dark-haired one’ or ‘little dark one.’

19. Fergus

The name Fergus means ‘strong one.’

20. Archie

The name Archie means ‘strong’ and ‘brave’ can be used on its own as a shortened version of Archibald.

21. Aodh

Aodh is a Scottish Gaelic name that means ‘fire.’

22. Uisdean

This Scottish Gaelic name is thought to mean ‘forever stone’ and ‘island stone.’

23. Grant

The name Grant means ‘tall’ and ‘large.’

24. Duncan

This traditional name means ‘chieftain’ and ‘battle.’

25. Camden

As well as being a London place name, Camden means ‘winding valley.’

26. Adair

The name Adair is believed to mean ‘oak tree ford.’

27. Blake

The name Blake means ‘dark-haired.’

28. Broderick

The name Broderick means ‘brother.’

29. Callum

The name Callum means ‘bald dove.’

30. Ross

Ross means ‘headland.’

31. Iain

The name Iain means ‘the Lord is gracious.’

32. Boyd

The name Boyd means ‘yellow.’

33. Donald

Donald is a traditional Scottish name that means ‘world-ruler.’

34. Cairn

The name Cairn means ‘someone who lives by a cairn.’

35. Bryce

Bryce means ‘freckled’ and ‘speckled’ and can also be spelt as Brice.

36. Braden

This Gaelic name means ‘salmon.’

37. Craig

Craig means ‘rocky hill’ or ‘crag.’

38. Buchanan

Buchanan is a surname but also makes an excellent first name that means ‘from the cannon’s seat.’

39. Malcolm

The name Malcolm means ‘devotee of Saint Columba.’

40. Cailean

The name Cailean means ‘child.’

41. Mac

Mac means ‘son of.’

42. Karson

The name Karson means ‘son of marsh dwellers.’

43. Kenneth

The name Kenneth means ‘handsome.’

44. Carlton

Carlton is a Scottish name that means ‘from the land between streams.’

45. Cory

The name Cory means ‘seething pool’ and ‘cauldron.’

46. Dalziel

The name Dalziel means ‘from the little field.’

47. Donal

The name Donal means ‘great ruler.’

48. Alexander

This strong Scottish name means ‘defender of mankind.’

49. Graham

The name Graham is a common surname and popular first name that means ‘gravelly dwelling.’

50. Crayton

The name Crayton means ‘border dweller.’

51. Fraser

Fraser is a Scottish name that means ‘of the forest men.’

52. Durrell

The name Durrell means ‘strong.’

53. Alasdair

Alasdair means ‘defender of men.’

54. Douglas

Douglas is a traditional Scottish boy’s name and means ‘from the dark water.’ Dougie makes a super cute nickname for Douglas.

55. Eoghan

The name Eoghan means ‘young.’

56. Lindsay

Lindsay is a Scottish male name meaning ‘the place of linden trees.’

57. Gavin

The name Gavin means ‘God send.’

58. Rory

The name Rory means ‘red king’ and is derived from the Gaelic name Ruaridh.

59. Frasier

The name Frasier means ‘of the forest men’ and can also be spelt as Frazier.

60. David

The name David means ‘beloved’ and has been the name of Scottish kings in the Middle Ages.

61. Evander

The name Evander means ‘strong man.’

62. Monroe

Monroe makes a unique Scottish first name and means ‘from the mouth of the river.’

63. Erroll

The name Erroll means ‘nobleman.’

64. Gawain

Gawain is the original Gaelic version of Gavin and means ‘God send’ and ‘little hawk.’

65. Acair

Acair is a Gaelic name that means ‘anchor.’

66. Stennis

Stennis is inspired by the place name in the Orkneys.

67. Finn

The name Finn means ‘fair’ and is of Gaelic origin.

68. Kade

The Gaelic name Kade means ‘from the wetlands.’

69. Ivor

Ivor is a name that means ‘yew,’ ‘bow,’ and ‘archer.’

70. Ferris

The name Ferris means ‘son of Fergus.’

71. Alistair

Alistair is a variation of the name Alasdair and means ‘defender of men.’

72. Fingal

The name Fingal means ‘fair stranger.’

73. Berkley

The name Berkley means ‘ash tree meadow.’

80. Findlay

The name Findlay is Gaelic and means ‘fair warrior.’

81. Ewan

The Scottish name Ewan means ‘youth.’

82. Fletcher

The name Fletcher means ‘arrow maker.’

83. Sinclair

The name Sinclair means ‘bright’ and ‘clear.’

84. Keith

Keith is a Scottish name meaning ‘woodland.’

85. Gordon

The Scottish name Gordon means ‘great hill’ and ‘fort.’

86. Campbell

Campbell is a Gaelic name meaning ‘wry mouth.’

87. Gregory

The Scottish name Gregory means ‘watchful.’

88. Angus

Angus is a Scottish name that means ‘one’ and ‘choice.’

89. Hamish

Hamish is a Scottish variation of the name James which means ‘supplanter.’

90. Irving

Irving is a Scottish name meaning ‘green river.’

91. Lyle

The name Lyle means ‘from the island.’

92. Keir

Keir is a short but sweet Scottish name that means ‘the dark one.’

93. Kinnon

Kinnon is a cool Scottish name for boys and means ‘fair born.’

94. Laine

Laine is distinctive Scottish boy’s name which means ‘serves John.’

95. Erwyn

The name Erwyn means ‘high cliff.’

96. Ramsay

Ramsay is a surname that works well as a Scottish first name and means ‘wild garlic’ and ‘ram’s island.’

97. Kirk

Kirk is a Scottish baby name meaning ‘from the church.’

98. Roderick

Roderick means ‘famous ruler.’

99. Wallace

The name Wallace means ‘Welsh speaker.’

100. Stirling

Stirling is a distinctive Scottish boy’s name that means ‘pure’ and ‘genuine.’
